repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: We use `void *` for option default values, which is confusing and can cause problems with type-correctness. It also doesn't accomodate for multitype options. On top of that, it also leads to default boolean option values not behaving correctly on big endian systems.

Solution: Use `OptVal` for option default values.

BREAKING CHANGE:
- `:set {option}<` removes the local value for all global-local options instead of just string global-local options.
- `:setlocal {option}<` copies the global value to the local value for number and boolean global-local options instead of removing the local value.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  OptVal def_val;    ///< default values for variable (neovim!!)
```

```suggestion
  " setlocal so<
  set so<
  call assert_equal(5, &so)
  setglob so=8
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1395,6 +1395,7 @@ func Test_local_scrolloff()
   setlocal so<
   call assert_equal(5, &so)
   setglob so=8
+  set so<

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  " setlocal siso<
  set siso<
  call assert_equal(7, &siso)
  setglob siso=4
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1412,6 +1413,7 @@ func Test_local_scrolloff()
   setlocal siso<
   call assert_equal(7, &siso)
   setglob siso=4
+  set siso<

comment_data.body: Maybe `:set<` and `:setlocal<` should be exchanged for these two tests?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1633,11 +1636,12 @@ func Test_set_boolean_global_local_option()
   call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
   call assert_equal(1, &autoread)
 
-  " :setlocal {option}< removes the local value, so that the global value will be used.
+  " :setlocal {option}< copies the global value to the local value
   setglobal noautoread
   setlocal autoread
   setlocal autoread<
-  call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
+  "call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
+  call assert_equal(0, &l:autoread)
   call assert_equal(0, &autoread)

comment_data.body: I think this is fine as-is. I added some comments, lmk if that's fine
comment_data.diff_hunk:

   call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
   call assert_equal(1, &autoread)
 
-  " :setlocal {option}< removes the local value, so that the global value will be used.
+  " :setlocal {option}< copies the global value to the local value
   setglobal noautoread
   setlocal autoread
   setlocal autoread<
-  call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
+  "call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
+  call assert_equal(0, &l:autoread)
   call assert_equal(0, &autoread)

comment_data.body: I pushed a fixup commit so you see what I mean.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1633,11 +1636,12 @@ func Test_set_boolean_global_local_option()
   call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
   call assert_equal(1, &autoread)
 
-  " :setlocal {option}< removes the local value, so that the global value will be used.
+  " :setlocal {option}< copies the global value to the local value
   setglobal noautoread
   setlocal autoread
   setlocal autoread<
-  call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
+  "call assert_equal(-1, &l:autoread)
+  call assert_equal(0, &l:autoread)
   call assert_equal(0, &autoread)

@@ -125,27 +131,48 @@ local function get_cond(c, base_string)
   return cond_string
 end
 
+--- @param s string
+--- @return string
+local cstr_to_string = function(s)

@@ -125,27 +131,48 @@ local function get_cond(c, base_string)
   return cond_string
 end
 
+--- @param s string
+--- @return string
+local cstr_to_string = function(s)
+  return ('{ .data = %s, .size = sizeof(%s) - 1 }'):format(s, s)
+end
+
+--- @param v vim.option_value|function
+--- @return string
+local get_opt_val = function(v)
+  --- @type vim.option_type
+  local v_type
+
+  if type(v) == 'function' then
+    v, v_type = v() --[[ @as string, vim.option_type ]]
+
+    if v_type == 'string' then
+      v = cstr_to_string(v)
+    end
+  else
+    v_type = type(v) --[[ @as vim.option_type ]]
+
+    if v_type == 'boolean' then
+      v = v and 'true' or 'false'
+    elseif v_type == 'number' then
+      v = ('%iL'):format(v)
+    elseif v_type == 'string' then
+      v = cstr_to_string(cstr(v))

@@ -125,27 +131,48 @@ local function get_cond(c, base_string)
   return cond_string
 end
 
+--- @param s string
+--- @return string
+local cstr_to_string = function(s)
+  return ('{ .data = %s, .size = sizeof(%s) - 1 }'):format(s, s)
+end
+
+--- @param v vim.option_value|function
+--- @return string
+local get_opt_val = function(v)
+  --- @type vim.option_type
+  local v_type
+
+  if type(v) == 'function' then
+    v, v_type = v() --[[ @as string, vim.option_type ]]
+
+    if v_type == 'string' then
+      v = cstr_to_string(v)

comment_data.body:
why do people add extra whitespace in lists. lists presentation can/should be decided by the renderer. there is no need to add even more whitespace between list items.

```suggestion

  of just string |global-local| options.
```

   is no longer treated specially for 'statuscolumn'.
 
+• `:set {option}<` removes the local value for all |global-local| options instead

comment_data.body: It seems that `P_INSECURE` flag is no longer cleared when using `:set all&`

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(options)!: use `OptVal` for option default values
